title: make_reference
description: Build a transcriptomics reference into one of many formats.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

id.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the reference
id.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the reference.

genome_fasta.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `https:/ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/gencode/Gencode_human/release_41/GRCh38.primary_assembly.genome.fa.gz`. Reference genome fasta
genome_fasta.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `https:/ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/gencode/Gencode_human/release_41/GRCh38.primary_assembly.genome.fa.gz`. Reference genome fasta.

transcriptome_gtf.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `https:/ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/gencode/Gencode_human/release_41/gencode.v41.annotation.gtf.gz`. Reference transcriptome annotation
transcriptome_gtf.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `https:/ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/gencode/Gencode_human/release_41/gencode.v41.annotation.gtf.gz`. Reference transcriptome annotation.

ercc.description: Type: `file`, example: `https:/assets.thermofisher.com/TFS-Assets/LSG/manuals/ERCC92.zip`. ERCC sequence and annotation file
ercc.help_text: Type: `file`, example: `https:/assets.thermofisher.com/TFS-Assets/LSG/manuals/ERCC92.zip`. ERCC sequence and annotation file.

target.description: Type: List of `string`, default: `star`, multiple_sep: `";"`, choices: ``cellranger`, `cellranger_arc`, `bd_rhapsody`, `star``. Which reference indices to generate
target.help_text: Type: List of `string`, default: `star`, multiple_sep: `";"`, choices: ``cellranger`, `cellranger_arc`, `bd_rhapsody`, `star``. Which reference indices to generate.

output_fasta.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output_fasta.gz`, example: `genome_sequence.fa.gz`. Output genome sequence fasta
output_fasta.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output_fasta.gz`, example: `genome_sequence.fa.gz`. Output genome sequence fasta.

output_gtf.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output_gtf.gz`, example: `transcriptome_annotation.gtf.gz`. Output transcriptome annotation gtf
output_gtf.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output_gtf.gz`, example: `transcriptome_annotation.gtf.gz`. Output transcriptome annotation gtf.

subset_regex.description: Type: `string`, example: `(ERCC-00002|chr1)`. Will subset the reference chromosomes using the given regex
subset_regex.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `(ERCC-00002|chr1)`. Will subset the reference chromosomes using the given regex.

star_genome_sa_index_nbases.description: Type: `integer`, default: `14`. Length (bases) of the SA pre-indexing string
star_genome_sa_index_nbases.help_text:
Type: `integer`, default: `14`. Length (bases) of the SA pre-indexing string. Typically between 10 and 15.
Longer strings will use much more memory, but allow faster searches. For small
genomes, the parameter {genomeSAindexNbases must be scaled down to
min(14, log2(GenomeLength)/2 - 1).

bdrhap_mitochondrial_contigs.description: Type: List of `string`, default: `chrM;chrMT;M;MT`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Names of the Mitochondrial contigs in the provided Reference Genome
bdrhap_mitochondrial_contigs.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, default: `chrM;chrMT;M;MT`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Names of the Mitochondrial contigs in the provided Reference Genome. Fragments originating from contigs other than these are
identified as 'nuclear fragments' in the ATACseq analysis pipeline.

bdrhap_filtering_off.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. By default the input Transcript Annotation files are filtered based on the gene_type/gene_biotype attribute
bdrhap_filtering_off.help_text:
Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. By default the input Transcript Annotation files are filtered based on the gene_type/gene_biotype attribute. Only features 
having the following attribute values are kept:

  - protein_coding
  - lncRNA 
  - IG_LV_gene
  - IG_V_gene
  - IG_V_pseudogene
  - IG_D_gene
  - IG_J_gene
  - IG_J_pseudogene
  - IG_C_gene
  - IG_C_pseudogene
  - TR_V_gene
  - TR_V_pseudogene
  - TR_D_gene
  - TR_J_gene
  - TR_J_pseudogene
  - TR_C_gene

  If you have already pre-filtered the input Annotation files and/or wish to turn-off the filtering, please set this option to True.

bdrhap_wta_only_index.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Build a WTA only index, otherwise builds a WTA + ATAC index
bdrhap_wta_only_index.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Build a WTA only index, otherwise builds a WTA + ATAC index.

bdrhap_extra_star_params.description: Type: `string`, example: `--limitGenomeGenerateRAM 48000 --genomeSAindexNbases 11`. Additional parameters to pass to STAR when building the genome index
bdrhap_extra_star_params.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `--limitGenomeGenerateRAM 48000 --genomeSAindexNbases 11`. Additional parameters to pass to STAR when building the genome index. Specify exactly like how you would on the command line.

motifs_file.description: Type: `file`. Path to file containing transcription factor motifs in JASPAR format
motifs_file.help_text: Type: `file`. Path to file containing transcription factor motifs in JASPAR format.

non_nuclear_contigs.description:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Name(s) of contig(s) that do not have any chromatin structure, for example, 
mitochondria or plastids
non_nuclear_contigs.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Name(s) of contig(s) that do not have any chromatin structure, for example, 
mitochondria or plastids. These contigs are excluded from peak calling since
the entire contig will be "open" due to a lack of chromatin structure.
Leave empty if there are no such contigs.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
